Fremont, California Type: Full-time Min. Experience: Some Experience Salary: $80,000 - $90,000 Fremont, California Type: Full-time Type: Min. Experience: Some Experience Min. Experience: Salary: $80,000 - $90,000 Salary: As a Junior Data Scientist, you will help support the Senior Data Scientist in analysis and research, and machine learning modeling that is underpinning new and current products. Additionally, the Junior Data Scientist will support the Data Engineer in building new data pipelines including new ETL functions. Essential Duties/Responsibilities  Data Analysis Data Cleaning and Preprocessing Model Development and Feature Engineering Research Data Visualization Documentation  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in STEM field using applied statistics and/or machine learning with two plus years of experience. Strong statistical and mathematical skills: You should have a strong understanding of statistical concepts such as probability theory, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and machine learning algorithms. Proficiency in programming languages: You should be proficient in at least one programming language, such as Python or R. You should also be familiar with SQL for data querying and manipulation. Data manipulation and visualization: You should be able to clean, manipulate, and transform data using tools like pandas and numpy in Python or tidyverse in R. You should also be able to create effective data visualizations using libraries such as Matplotlib or ggplot2. Familiarity with machine learning algorithms: You should have a basic understanding of machine learning algorithms such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, and clustering techniques. Communication skills: You should have excellent communication skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Collaboration skills: The ability to work collaboratively with other team members, including data engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders, can be beneficial for you in delivering successful projects. Problem-solving skills: You should be able to identify and solve complex problems, often with incomplete or imperfect data. Attention to detail: You should have excellent attention to detail, ensuring that your data analysis is accurate and error-free. Continuous learning: You should be willing to learn new skills and keep up with the latest industry trends and developments.  Nice-to-have skills and Experience  Experience with AGILE/SCRUM/JIRA. Experience with the AWS cloud platform. Understanding of deep learning algorithms. Domain expertise: Having domain expertise in criminal justice, crime analysis and/or risk calculation. Knowledge of data ethics and privacy. Project management skills – scoping, planning, and executing  Location: Fremont, CA  SoundThinking provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, SoundThinking complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  SoundThinking expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of SoundThinking’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact SoundThinking at +1.510.794.3183 or careers@soundthinking.com for assistance. column131: interactive process to identify reasonable accommodations that can be made without imposing an undue hardship. Junior Data Scientist (Co-op)  IMPACT and OPPORTUNITY  At Gentherm
column132: we are expanding our human research testing capabilities and are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our new thermal physiology research team. The team sits at the forefront of the company’s mission in developing thermal solutions that improve health
column133: wellness and comfort. The Junior Data Scientist will play an integral role in supporting our data infrastructure and analyzing the influx of quantitative and qualitative data from the thermophysiology research team. This includes human physiological and perceptual data from laboratory-based and real-world driving studies and automotive data from vehicles and our thermal solutions. The Junior Data Scientist will assist in the development of individual-specific mathematical models and artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms for predicting personalized comfort and wellness. Whilst the candidate should be grounded in fundamental principles of data science methods

column5: Data Analyst  Position Summary As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role on RaiseRight’s Data and Analytics team. You will partner with RaiseRight leaders of the product and marketing teams to understand their key initiatives and ultimately provide strategic recommendations based on insights you uncover with your analytical superpowers. You will be responsible for performing research and deep-dive analysis of various data sources collected in our warehouse and clearly communicating your findings with presentations and documentation.  What You Will Do Be a subject matter expert of our app analytics (mobile, web) and user tracking throughout our products. Develop a strong understanding of how customers behave through data and research. Partner with product and marketing teams to coordinate experiments utilizing A/B and multivariate testing strategies. Collaborate on the creation of metrics to track product performance and develop dashboards to communicate product impact. Deliver presentations of findings and recommendations through written narratives with supporting visualizations of quantitative information. Maintain data dictionary documentation related to analytic models and reporting ensuring definitions are consistent and up to date.  Who You Are You have 2+ years of professional experience in a data analytics or analyst role. You use SQL daily in your current role and are proficient in writing analytical SQL. You are also passionate about coding SQL for performance, readability, and style. Major bonus if you have experience with the DBT platform. You have used Python or R when SQL was insufficient for complex reporting or analysis. You are proficient in statistical methodologies and concepts. A good understanding of data warehouses and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Periscope, Looker) You have 1+ years of experience and are currently working with one of the modern Cloud Data Warehousing technologies: Redshift, Snowflake, or Azure Synapse.  Why You Should Work For Us A mission driven culture Competitive compensation Generous health benefits including medical, dental and vision 401K matching plan and profit sharing up to 10% Paid parental leave PTO including a paid day to commit to volunteering in your community Direct employee earning through RaiseRight program  RaiseRight is the largest gift card fundraising platform in the United States, helping 50,000 organizations raise over $800 million for initiatives that matter to them. Families purchase gift cards to use in their everyday shopping and earn rebates from retailers to offset expenses such as school tuition, athletic equipment, band trips, and church operations. Fundraising through everyday spending is disrupting the traditional methods of selling baked goods, organizing annual events or asking for donations. It is simply the right way to fundraise. eXqsGzyxkO Data Analyst Data Analyst Position Summary Position Summary As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role on RaiseRight’s Data and Analytics team. Salary $67,684.00 - $81,221.00 Annually Location 201 S Greene Street Greensboro, NC Job Type Full Time Job Number 03011 Department Human Resources Opening Date 07/31/2023 Closing Date Continuous Salary $67,684.00 - $81,221.00 Annually Location 201 S Greene Street Greensboro, NC Salary $67,684.00 - $81,221.00 Annually Salary Salary Salary $67,684.00 - $81,221.00 Annually $67,684.00 - $81,221.00 Annually Location 201 S Greene Street Greensboro, NC Location Location Location 201 S Greene Street Greensboro, NC 201 S Greene Street Greensboro, NC Job Type Full Time Job Number 03011 Job Type Full Time Job Type Job Type Job Type Full Time Full Time Job Number 03011 Job Number Job Number Job Number 03011 03011 Department Human Resources Opening Date 07/31/2023 Department Human Resources Department Department Department Human Resources Human Resources Opening Date 07/31/2023 Opening Date Opening Date Opening Date 07/31/2023 07/31/2023 Closing Date Continuous Closing Date Continuous Closing Date Closing Date Closing Date Continuous Continuous Description   GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES This is a professional and technical position performing complex data analysis of the HR information system data.  DISTINGUISHING FEATURES OF THIS CLASS This position performs complex data analysis of HR information system data. Develops HR dashboard and reports to communicate HR data, analyzes results using statistical techniques, develops analytical models, and provides timely and accurate analysis to positively influence the organization's ability to make informed decisions. Role requires strong technical capabilities in managing and analyzing large amounts of data, understanding relationships between ERP and various HR systems. General understanding of HR functions, budgeting, strategic planning, quality improvement is a plus. Role may require partnering with various departments - i.e. Budget, Finance, IT, Administration.  Work with large amounts of data to identify, interpret, and analyze trends and patterns using statistical techniques. Develop analytical models that clearly communicate HR data, allowing for timely, informed organizational decisions. Communicate with report and data requesters to understand and interpret data requests. Identify and execute appropriate methods to communicate data and metrics. Lead the collection, compilation and analysis of data in the development of HR department metrics. Collaborate with others across the organization to review trends and patterns related to metrics. Extract applicable data from ERP systems and databases. Able to pull queries from databases, perform advanced excel functions. Provide metrics in a format that is easily understood by varied audiences. Serve as an HR project manager, partnering with IT, Finance and other HR employees for activities related to ERP systems, databases, system upgrades, modifications, implementations, and other assigned projects. Evaluate processes for improvement opportunities and able to provide guidance based on needs of the organization. Leads analysis to identify, correct and/or re-engineer HR processes and create/modify system fields to ensure capturing quality data. Create Standard Operating Procedures documents. Perform data updates in HR systems. Troubleshoot and correct errors entered into HR systems. Compile data for Federal reporting and Public Records Requests assigned to HR. Perform other duties as required or requested.  RECRUITMENT STANDARDS Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Knowledge of data management, project management and best practices. Knowledge of HR operations, programs and systems along with understanding integration. Advanced skills and understanding of queries, databases, report writing, advanced excel functions including add-ins, VLOOKUP and pivot tables. Ability to present data results and findings. Ability to verbally and in writing communicate technical issues and effectively provide technical information to various audiences. Ability to manipulate large amounts of data, recognize missing data, anticipate errors, understand data relationships across systems. Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications to design and build analysis solutions. Ability to create reports, dashboards and visualizations to understand business performance. Ability to creatively collaborate to implement changes in HR Systems to institute HR offerings. Typical Qualifications MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Human Resources or a related field and three years of related work experience demonstrating progressively responsible technical experience. Supplemental Information Physical Demands An employee in this position must be able to physically perform the basic life operational functions of walking, fingering, grasping, talking, hearing, and repetitive motions. The employee must be able to perform sedentary work exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects. Working Conditions Work consists of an office environment with no adverse environmental conditions.  May Require Driving This position may require driving for this position whether driving a County owned or personal vehicle to conduct county business such as but not limited to attending conferences, meetings, or any other county related functions. Motor Vehicle Reports may be verified for valid driver’s license and that the driving record is compatible with the county’s driving criteria. If a personal vehicle is operated for county business proper insurance is maintained by the employee as per Guilford County’s vehicle use policy.  Special Note: This generic class description gives an overview of the job class, its essential functions and recommended job requirements. However, for each individual position assigned to this class, there is available a completed job description with physical abilities checklist which can be reviewed before initiating a selection process. They can provide additional detailed information on which to base various personnel actions and can assist management in making legal defensible personnel decisions. Hybrid : 3 days in office on Tues, Wed and Thurs. Mon/Fri will be remote from home. Duration : 11 Months Hybrid : Duration : 11 Months Job Description: A Data Analyst interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to improve a business, thus affecting business decisions. Data Analysts gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends as such a Data Analyst job description should highlight the analytical nature of the role. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues. Role will include data entry into the SAP ERP system as well as problem solving to troubleshoot day to day issues in a fast-paced DSD snacks environment. Must have the ability to multitask, communicate effectively, and learn quickly while being detail oriented and provide excellent customer service. Proven MS Excel experience a plus - v lookups, pivot tables and manipulate large amounts of Excel. The candidate will take large data dumps out of SAP that need to be manipulated - will be using formulas and keeping track of where they are in the spreadsheet Job Description: Primary Responsibilities: - Collaborate to design and develop schemas and data acquisition, transformations, and data integration. - Develop and utilize software to interface big data and relational solutions. - Design and implement solutions for metadata, data quality, privacy management. - Support and consult with the development staff. - Collecting and interpreting data - Analyzing results - Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business - Identifying patterns and trends in data sets - Working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs - Defining new data collection and analysis processes Primary Responsibilities: Qualifications: - Technical Degree or related work experience - Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations. - Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms. - High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases. - Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases. At Shell Energy Solutions, we believe there’s a better way to power your business and home. Aligned with Shell’s ambition to be a significant global power business and to become net zero by 2050, our cleaner, affordable, and simple solutions help companies manage their energy spend and plan their sustainability roadmap - a fresh approach for environmentally conscious businesses that are looking to boost their sustainability credentials. We also have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels. Shell Energy Solutions mission is delivering cleaner energy solutions for a brighter tomorrow by guiding customers toward a better energy future, enabling customer choice and by providing market-leading energy solutions. Going above and beyond for our customers is what we’re all about and we have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels. But bigger challenges lie ahead, and we need to keep moving forward. Are you ready to help us get there? WHERE YOU FIT IN We are looking for a highly motivated individual with a genuine interest in energy, technology, and a passion to deliver products for a growing company. The Data Analyst II is a member of the Operations Team who will work across functionality to ensure accurate data and utilize reports to measure performance of customer consumption and energy savings. This includes supporting and maintaining strong working relationships with Shell Energy’s third-party partners. The Data Analyst II should have a continuous improvement mentality and look for opportunities to enhance Shell Energy’s processes. This role is a great opportunity for a candidate who enjoys analyzing data in various ways and working with a growing team to create consistency and efficiency. Reporting into the Solutions Operations Manager, the role requires self-motivated, dedicated, and responsible individual with the ability to perform well under pressure. JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Extract, scrub, and analyze core customer data which serves as the basis for key performance indicators to maximize customer savings. Gain understanding of our various processes which support key business functionality including bill data extraction, data management, etc. and utilize that understanding to drive customer savings. Maintain the quality of data output by utilizing standardized and repeatable processes. Assist with preparation, development, and review of customer quarterly performance assessments. Perform operational processes to ensure the day-to-day success of Shell Energy and its customers. Support operational efficiency through ad-hoc requests and reporting. Review and assist the support of key vendor management processes. Effectively communicate project status and provide timely escalation of issues to ensure project objectives are met. Collaborate with teams across the business to identify and evaluate strategies that foster long-term success. Other duties as assigned ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 2+ years of experience in retail electric or renewable energy operations. High School diploma required; Bachelor’s degree preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; must be able to provide timely and accurate data analysis. Strong business writing skills and experience developing communication in various formats. Learner mindset and eye for continuous improvement needs. Organization and time management skills, with the ability to maintain a strict level of attention to detail Ability to work well within a team environment and demonstrate a vested interest in team goals and objectives Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, with the ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships Self-motivated with the desire to consistently improve performance and gain further knowledge Ability to meet deadlines, learn quickly and demonstrate effective problem solving and follow-up skills Comply with company policies and procedure LOCATION & WORK SCHEDULE Required to be in-person in The Woodlands/Houston, TX through a hybrid workplace environment BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH SHELL ENERGY Competitive Compensation Health Care - Medical/Dental/Vision/Prescription Drug Coverage 401(k) with Company Matching Contributions Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) Health Savings Accounts (HSA) Disability Programs (STD & LTD) Employee Basic Term Life Insurance Generous Vacation & Company Holidays Flexible hybrid working schedule Training and coaching Tuition Reimbursement Paid Parental Leave And much more! SHELL ENERGY VALUES Shell is a company with shared values. Honesty, integrity, and respect aren't simply a strapline: they are part of everything we do. What's more, Shell is an equal opportunities company, and we place the highest possible value on the diversity of our people and our inclusive approach. Join us and you’ll belong to a world where you are proud of your achievements and propel your career with global opportunities. We care deeply about fostering a truly diverse workplace. Job descriptions are not intended as, nor should be construed to be, exhaustive lists of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with a job. They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job duties and responsibilities essential for making fair pay decisions about the job. Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst (Hybrid Onsite - Locals Required) Location: Lansing, MI Duration: 12 Months Experience Level: 12+ Years Business Analyst 5, DTMB Agency Services Supporting EGLE DTMB Agency Services is in need of a Business Analyst 5 to provide excellent customer service supporting both project and work request needs for the Environment, Great Lakes and Energy (EGLE) Agency. This person will have the opportunity to support strategic initiatives to provide increased efficiencies and public support for multiple program areas. Key responsibilities include being the liaison between DTMB and the project stakeholders, as well as providing expert facilitation and elicitation to help develop strategy and requirements for future enhancements and related work projects. In addition, as part of the overall support for EGLE, this person will be a critical member of the DTMB Agency Services Business Analyst team, participating in various related work requests for EGLE and contributing to the operational activities of the BA team. The ideal candidate will possess SOM DTMB process experience; strong facilitator experience using facilitation for requirements elicitation; experience with gap fit analysis and requirements refinement for inflight efforts; experience with LEAN principles; and have a working understanding of contract compliance. Customer service and being a champion to ease Agency compliance with DTMB policies and practices are key performance expectations for this person. They must be able to quickly gain a working understanding of applicable constraints and enablers and help EGLE navigate those for the success for their projects and work requests. A common day would include attendance in various standing meetings for each of the work items/projects, listening to understand needs, and helping to provide input that assists in meeting the objectives of the respective meetings; leading discussions to understand and identify strategic direction and impact; as well as complete analysis for related work products and deliverables. DTMB Agency Services and EGLE welcomes candidates that are self-directed, well organized, confident in their ability to build relationships, quick to come up to speed on new assignments, and able to be flexible and adaptable to changing needs and/or direction. Candidates must have a minimum of 12 years of general BA experience. minimum of 12 years of general BA experience At the discretion of the resource manager, this position may include remote work, but candidate should plan to be available to report to a Lansing, MI job location in accordance with State of Michigan return to office guidelines. As a Business Analyst, you will act as the liaison between the business and the solution providers, connecting both worlds during product/process/service definition, implementation, testing, final validation and deployment. You will be responsible to elicit requirements from different departments and propose different solutions to best answer business needs and opportunities. You will work closely with the Business Architect to ensure the product or service implemented aligns with Company business needs and overall goals and objectives. PRINCIPAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES (ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS): Assist Project Managers in project scope definition and other project documents creation Participate in the analysis of the business context and identify any stakeholders (i.e. impacted business groups or processes) Lead the requirements elicitation process with business representatives and documents the stakeholder expectations, functional requirements, nonfunctional requirements Participates and continuously improves the organization by developing and maintaining business processes as digital workflows Participates in the overall testing and qualification phase of the project Responsible for solution validation and ensuring they are aligned with defined requirements Actively participates in the technical feasibility studies, including with complex data analysis Provides senior management evaluations and recommendations on considered solutions Collaborates with the Information Systems teams to define possible technical solutions Actively participates in the creation of necessary transformation documents to provide business case validation after implementation Assists in the planning and execution of regular gap analysis throughout testing Performs data analysis using SQL on complex data models and may build reports to support project delivery requirements As a Business Analyst, you will act as the liaison between the business and the solution providers, connecting both worlds during product/process/service definition, implementation, testing, final validation and deployment. About Energo Energo is a rapidly growing energy supplier that provides a broad range of energy products and services to customers in NY, NJ, PA and MD. Please visit our website for more information: https://energo.com/ Energo is an equal opportunity employer, and applicants considered will not be because of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Job Summary Energo is seeking a positive, goal-oriented Analytics Data Analyst. The Analytics Data Analyst is a key member of the Systems and Risk team and will primarily be supporting the Operations department with customer enrollments, database management, billing, and reporting. Attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment, organizational skills and ability to organize and analyze data are necessary skills to succeed within this role. Multi-tasking is a must! Company offers a competitive salary based on experience, benefits, and 401K plan. Overview Responsibilities: Develop, implement, and improve data collection and reporting for both internal and external teams Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain data systems Interpret, process and analyze complex billing data for Operations Assist with the enhancement of the billing system to meet the requirements necessary to enroll and bill customers receiving energy supply from Energo Proactively identify and implement operational improvements, enhancements, and system customizations that meet business requirements Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Support weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting Ad hoc assignments This position reports to the VP of Risk and Systems. We are seeking candidates who meet the following criteria: Bachelor’s degree 1-3 years work experience required 1-3 years experience with a retail energy company preferred Proficiency in SQL, Python or VBA, Microsoft Office and Excel required. The Data Scientist designs, prototypes, and develops processes for machine learning models from experimentation to production. They must work with the Data Science Department to understand current business cases, test hypotheses, and continuously improve active processes. This is a technical role that focuses on data wrangling, feature engineering, and predictive modeling.  The Data Scientist will collaborate with their team to prepare and develop data, features, and predictive models from ideation to production deployment. Current use case datasets are primarily tabular. Potential use cases include time series forecasting, clustering, binary classification, multiclass classification, multivariate regression, anomaly detection, and recommendation systems. Once approved, the Data Scientist will work with the team to transition experimental models to production models.  This role involves a high degree of hypothesis generation, experimentation, validation, and analysis. You must work with stakeholders to understand business processes and leverage domain expertise.  Responsibilities: Prototype, test, and manage iterations of model pipelines to train, deploy, infer and monitor machine learning models at scale Ingest, clean, explore, and analyze data for actionable conclusions Iteratively train production models Data wrangling and validation Hypothesis formation and testing Develop an understanding of how the data and models relate to business processes Collaborate and communicate across teams to understand model viability Perform feature engineering and testing Build machine learning models Assemble reports and present findings Test and continuously improve models in various stages of deployment Convert proven experiments to lean, scalable, container-based models Document and catalogue models and processes  Requirements: Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field 3 years of professional experience in data science/machine learning Experience in multiple machine learning frameworks (e.g., Sci-kit Learn, PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras) Experience in production model design Familiarity and knowledge of Algorithm design Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Git version control (preferred) Familiarity with AWS Ecosystem preferred (Sagemaker, DynamoDB, S3, EC2) Familiarity with Docker is a plus Proficiency with PySpark is a plus Good understanding of serverless technologies (such as AWS Lambda and Step functions or similar cloud services) is a plus Experience with managing and architecting solutions on AWS or similar public clouds Ability to communicate information between technical and non-technical teams Ability to identify problems, challenges, and opportunities for improvement  Benefits: 401K Paid Vacation and Sick Time off Paid Parental Leave Health, Dental and Vision Insurance Coverage Short term/Long Term Disability Insurance Coverage Life Insurance Coverage Perks: Wellness Reimbursement Tuition Reimbursement In-home Vet Care Referral bonus Relocation Assistance Free parking Friday lunch catering Daily free snacks and drinks Yearly mini paid holiday company trip Lunch and Learn Sessions AFFIRMATIVE ACTION/EQUAL Los Angeles, California Advertising At Netflix, we seek to entertain the world. We have more than 200 million members in 190 countries, reflecting that great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere.  In Nov 2022, we launched a new lower-priced, ad-supported tier for our customers. We are now continuing to build on our goal of providing more choice for consumers and a premium, better-than-linear TV brand experience for advertisers. That said, we are looking for the founding members of this new business area for Netflix!  The Ads Data Science and Engineering team at Netflix’s mission is to help build the foundation of the ads business at Netflix. We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more choices and joy for our members. You’ll work closely with partner teams to build workflows, provide recommendations and drive success on end-to-end analytics initiatives in this 0 -1 space.  We are seeking a Staff Data Scientist who can help with foundational problems like Experimentation and Valuation in the ads space. This is an opportunity to partner with a diverse range of cross-functional business partners to uncover new opportunities, design, execute, and analyze experiments, and deliver solutions that have a significant business impact and implications for our users. Experimentation techniques are crucial to the long-term success of our ads business, and you will be a key leader driving this area for Netflix.  You will help drive innovations through effective identification and application of analytics, causal inference, experimentation and machine learning. This is a high-impact role in which you will have direct influence on how product decisions are made. In this role, you will: Lead the area of Experimentation for Ads Platform, and autonomously identify and pursue research with significant business impact, and make compelling cases for prioritization and resource allocation Cultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etc. Execute and present strong research and insights, disseminate knowledge and get others behind their ideas, and foster an open environment of collaboration, innovation, and intellectual excitement. Deliver technically excellent solutions using modeling and ML, data exploration and strong documentation with an eye toward impact and contribution to the larger DSE community. Be a thought leader for Product, Strategy and Engineering teams in the areas of Experimentation for Ads. We are looking for: Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field Leadership (staff level) experience with large-scale data with proven ability to lead cross-functionally, work independently and galvanize others Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - having utilized in experimentation or other product analytics settings Strong product knowledge and intuition - having utilized in consumer/user interface settings or internally serving technical audiences such as engineers. Demonstrated ability to communicate and drive product change across a variety of stakeholders Strong SQL skills and Quantitative Programming skills in Python or R Ability to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at many different levels. Mentors, brainstorms with, and enables others, especially within your functional area Actively builds and fosters technical communities internally (e.g., horizontal forums, seminars, and summits) and externally (e.g., conference participation) Exemplary stewardship of Netflix’s culture and values, particularly in terms of selflessness and ensuring open debate of ideas and encouraging the inclusion of a variety of perspectives regardless of seniority At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your persona ltop of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.  The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $390,000 - $900,000.  This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. In this role, you will: Lead the area of Experimentation for Ads Platform, and autonomously identify and pursue research with significant business impact, and make compelling cases for prioritization and resource allocation Cultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etc. Execute and present strong research and insights, disseminate knowledge and get others behind their ideas, and foster an open environment of collaboration, innovation, and intellectual excitement. Deliver technically excellent solutions using modeling and ML, data exploration and strong documentation with an eye toward impact and contribution to the larger DSE community. Be a thought leader for Product, Strategy and Engineering teams in the areas of Experimentation for Ads. We are looking for: Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field Leadership (staff level) experience with large-scale data with proven ability to lead cross-functionally, work independently and galvanize others Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - having utilized in experimentation or other product analytics settings Strong product knowledge and intuition - having utilized in consumer/user interface settings or internally serving technical audiences such as engineers. Demonstrated ability to communicate and drive product change across a variety of stakeholders Strong SQL skills and Quantitative Programming skills in Python or R Ability to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at many different levels. Mentors, brainstorms with, and enables others, especially within your functional area Actively builds and fosters technical communities internally (e.g., horizontal forums, seminars, and summits) and externally (e.g., conference participation) Exemplary stewardship of Netflix’s culture and values, particularly in terms of selflessness and ensuring open debate of ideas and encouraging the inclusion of a variety of perspectives regardless of seniority At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your persona ltop of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.  The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $390,000 - $900,000.  This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. We have more than 200 million members in 190 countries, reflecting that great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere.  In Nov 2022, we launched a new lower-priced, ad-supported tier for our customers. We are now continuing to build on our goal of providing more choice for consumers and a premium, better-than-linear TV brand experience for advertisers. That said, we are looking for the founding members of this new business area for Netflix! We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of creating more choices and joy for our members. Description/Duties First review of applications will be Tuesday, September 5, 2023.  The current recruitment will be used to fill two vacancies at either the Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst level and will be assigned primarily to the City's utility smart metering project. Assignment includes development of descriptive, predictive, and/or prescriptive analytic solutions related to the delivery and consumption of energy, and/or water to utility customers in the City of Mesa.  Preferred/Desirable skills specific to this assignment include professional work experience, knowledge of and/or demonstrated skills in the following: SQL Tools, Python, Azure Databricks, PowerBI, and cloud data warehouse such as Snowflake. Knowledge or experience in smart metering data tools, including Xylem Sensus, Harris Compass MDM, Milsoft Outage Management System, or similar toolkits is beneficial.  Data Analyst ($62,828.48 - $92,983.49 annually)  A Data Analyst is responsible for assisting departments and divisions with the development and use of data analysis and reporting solutions that provides actionable insights and informs managerial decision-making to address social, economic, and City management issues and to drive improvements to the City’s delivery of services. A Data Analyst creates, participates in, and ensures a successful data analytics practice that helps the City find trends; uncovers opportunities; predicts actions, triggers, or events; and makes decisions.  Work requires independent judgement and initiative in combining a broad scope of professional, organizational effectiveness, knowledge, and analytical judgement to assist with a variety of complex citywide issues. Incumbents are required to carry out assignments with general instruction and guidance, and to seek direction/information proactively. This position is expected to assess and promote data-driven practices that will improve City operations and outcomes for Mesa residents and visitors. A Data Analyst works with project teams and business clients to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into actionable projects. Employees in this class must demonstrate analytical skills, requirements gathering, and quality assurance; and must exercise professional discretion while performing day-to-day activities independently within established guidelines and procedures. This class is supervised by the Chief Data Officer who reviews work through conferences, reports, and overall results achieved. Employees may progress to a Senior Data Analyst by non-competitive promotion upon meeting specific criteria-based promotion requirements of performance, training, and experience. This class is FLSA exempt-administrative.  Senior Data Analyst ($72,734.69 - $107,644.37)  A Senior Data Analyst is responsible for assisting departments and divisions with the development and use of data analysis and reporting solutions that provides actionable insights and informs managerial decision-making to address social, economic, and City management issues and to drive improvements to the City’s delivery of services. A Senior Data Analyst creates, participates in, and ensures a successful data analytics practice that helps the City find trends; uncovers opportunities; predicts actions, triggers, or events; and makes decisions.  Work requires considerable independent judgement and initiative in combining a broad scope of professional, organizational effectiveness, knowledge, and analytical judgement to resolve a variety of complex citywide issues. Incumbents are required to carry out assignments without detailed instruction or guidance. This position is expected to assess and promote data-driven decision-making analysis that will improve City operations and outcomes for Mesa residents and visitors. Employees in this class must demonstrate analytical skills, as well as considerable working knowledge of methodologies and techniques for business process modeling, requirements gathering, and quality assurance; and must exercise professional discretion while performing day-to-day activities independently within established guidelines and procedures with minimal supervision. This class is supervised by the Chief Data Officer who reviews work through conferences, reports, and overall results achieved. Employees may progress to this class by non-competitive promotion upon meeting specific criteria-based promotion requirements of performance, training, and experience. This class is FLSA exempt-administrative.  Please refer to the link below for the full job description and additional information regarding assignments, preferred qualifications, and essential functions. Qualifications & Requirements Employee Values: All employees of the City of Mesa are expected to uphold and exhibit the City's shared employee values of Knowledge, Respect, and Integrity.  Data Analyst:  Minimum Qualifications Required. Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Public Administration, Organizational Development, Management Sciences, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field, OR graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree and completion from an accredited certificate program in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, or a related field. A minimum of three years full-time, professional work experience in a quantitative field with demonstrated expertise in statistical, analytical software (examples: SQL tools, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, common statistics programs, etc.). Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Master’s Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Public Administration, Organizational Development, Management Sciences, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field will be considered qualifying experience for both work experience and Bachelor’s Degree requirement.  Special Requirement. An individual must pass a background investigation through the City of Mesa Police Department (by assignment).  Preferred/Desirable Qualifications. Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Master’s Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or Statistics. Extensive (5+ years) professional work experience in a quantitative field with demonstrated expertise in statistical, analytical software (examples: SQL tools, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, common statistics programs, etc.).  Senior Data Analyst:  Minimum Qualifications Required. Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Public Administration, Organizational Development, Management Sciences, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field, OR graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree and completion from an accredited certificate program in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, or a related field. A minimum of five years full-time, professional work experience in a quantitative field with demonstrated expertise in statistical, analytical software (examples: SQL tools, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, common statistics programs, etc.). Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Master’s Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Public Administration, Organizational Development, Management Sciences, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field can substitute for two years of work experience. Two years of full-time employment with the City of Mesa as a Data Analyst and a Master’s Degree in a field described above will also be considered as meeting the minimum qualifications requirement.  Special Requirement. An individual must pass a background investigation through the City of Mesa Police Department (by assignment).  Preferred/Desirable Qualifications. Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Master’s Degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or Statistics. Extensive (5+ years) professional work experience in a quantitative field with demonstrated expertise in statistical, analytical software (examples: SQL tools, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Tableau, R, Python, Apache Spark, Qlik, Jupyter, other common statistics programs, etc.). Supervisory or lead experience. Description/Duties First review of applications will be Tuesday, September 5, 2023. Who We Are Who We Are We’re a family of health centers, supported by a family of Associates. For over 25 years, Health Choice Network (HCN) has been an employer of choice in South Florida, supporting health centers, patients, and the communities they serve. We are one of the first successful health center-controlled networks and our success is due largely to our Associates and their commitment to advancing our mission to improve the health status of our communities. Do you want to join an organization that believes in empowering their most precious resource, their Associates? Are you innovative and results driven? HCN is looking for talented, qualified individuals to join our rapidly expanding, first-class team. What We Are Looking For What We Are Looking For Join our team as a Research Data Analyst and play a crucial role in expanding our community health project portfolio across health center networks. You'll have the exciting opportunity to leverage data for patient outcomes and health services research, working closely with internal and external stakeholders. Reporting to the Research Data Scientist Manager, you'll be responsible for conducting data analyses aligned with health center research priorities, managing data for secondary and interventional studies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve our research and evaluation goals. If you're passionate about using health care data to make a meaningful impact, we'd love to hear from you! Position Expectations Position Expectations Demonstrate strict adherence to HIPAA regulations, Data Use Agreements, and HCN Research Standard Operating Procedures. Conduct advanced quantitative data analyses using both the networks' data infrastructure and other private/public datasets, employing advanced statistical and predictive analytics techniques. Collaborate closely with researchers and the data team to implement precise analytic plans that align with the project's objectives, ensuring data requests and outputs meet project needs. Place a high priority on data security to safeguard sensitive information. Additional duties and responsibilities assigned. Demonstrate strict adherence to HIPAA regulations, Data Use Agreements, and HCN Research Standard Operating Procedures. Conduct advanced quantitative data analyses using both the networks' data infrastructure and other private/public datasets, employing advanced statistical and predictive analytics techniques. Collaborate closely with researchers and the data team to implement precise analytic plans that align with the project's objectives, ensuring data requests and outputs meet project needs. Place a high priority on data security to safeguard sensitive information. Additional duties and responsibilities assigned. Skills and Abilities for Success Skills and Abilities for Success Working proficiency in data management and reporting platforms, ensuring efficient handling and presentation of data-driven insights. Data analysis and programming language proficiency, with a preference for R/RStudio, enabling sophisticated data processing and analysis. Experience with relational databases and database management systems, such as SQL and SQL Server Management Studio, ensuring effective data organization and retrieval. Ability to extract meaningful insights from data and provide actionable recommendations, surpassing mere metric reporting. Additional skills required for success. Working proficiency in data management and reporting platforms, ensuring efficient handling and presentation of data-driven insights. Data analysis and programming language proficiency, with a preference for R/RStudio, enabling sophisticated data processing and analysis. Experience with relational databases and database management systems, such as SQL and SQL Server Management Studio, ensuring effective data organization and retrieval. Ability to extract meaningful insights from data and provide actionable recommendations, surpassing mere metric reporting. Additional skills required for success. Education, Experience and Certifications Education, Experience and Certifications Bachelor's degree in data analysis or a health-related field, complemented by experience in information technology fields. Demonstrated expertise in data analysis, database management, and outcomes studies, strongly preferred. Proficient in standard desktop computing software packages, including word processing, spreadsheeting, presentation software, and internet browsers, among others. Preferred experience working with electronic health records and health information technology, adding valuable insights to the role. Bachelor's degree in data analysis or a health-related field, complemented by experience in information technology fields. Overview Overview Trissential is a trusted partner for end-to-end quality services and management consulting for digital transformation. As a part of our parent company, Expleo, we are a global organization partnering with major corporations and leading non-profits in over 30 countries. Guided by our mission and values, Trissential puts people at the heart of our organization. Come join an experience! Add your talent to a team of forward-thinking game changers that make an impact by driving innovative solutions. Trissential is currently seeking a Data Scientist to join our dynamic team in Minneapolis, MN (Remote). Data Scientist Minneapolis, MN (Remote) Responsibilities Responsibilities Position Summary: Position Summary: The Data Scientist is responsible for advising the business on the potential of data, to provide new insights into the business’s mission, and using advanced statistical analysis, data mining, and data visualization techniques, to create solutions that enable enhanced business performance. The Data Scientist also plays a leadership role in the management of several projects to leverage and synthesize large volumes and variety of data to enhance the business’s understanding of individual population segments, propensities, outcomes, and decision points. The Data Scientist is responsible for advising the business on the potential of data, to provide new insights into the business’s mission, and using advanced statistical analysis, data mining, and data visualization techniques, to create solutions that enable enhanced business performance. The Data Scientist also plays a leadership role in the management of several projects to leverage and synthesize large volumes and variety of data to enhance the business’s understanding of individual population segments, propensities, outcomes, and decision points. Primary Responsibilities and Accountabilities: Primary Responsibilities and Accountabilities: Work in close collaboration with the Data Science team to understand Data Science products, assists in the development and/or modification of new and existing products and functionality to adapt to evolving business needs (e.g., envisioning end-user experience, identifying needs of business-end consumers). Submit routine and ad-hoc queries to existing Data Science products in response to business team requests (e.g., leverage existing forecasting model(s) to produce weekly forecast updates on key business metrics). Utilize Data Science product outputs to develop routine and ad-hoc reports in response to requests from the business (e.g., read-in, filter, merge and/or summarize various data tables; compose narrative summaries of analytic findings). Facilitate delivery of new reporting solutions. Work with business owners to assess requests and define parameters. Manage and prioritize competing interests. Identify and conduct needs and value assessments for reporting requests from the business while maintaining and optimizing existing reports. Proactively conduct reviews of existing reports for accuracy, integrity, and relevance to the business. Responsible for unique and ongoing responsibilities as assigned. Hennepin Healthcare is an integrated system of care that includes HCMC, a nationally recognized Level I Adult Trauma Center and Level I Pediatric Trauma Center and acute care hospital, as well as a clinic system with primary care clinics located in Minneapolis and across Hennepin County. The comprehensive healthcare system includes a 473-bed academic medical center, a large outpatient Clinic & Specialty Center, and a network of clinics in the North Loop, Whittier, and East Lake Street neighborhoods of Minneapolis, and in the suburban communities of Brooklyn Park, Golden Valley, Richfield, and St. Anthony Village. Hennepin Healthcare has a large psychiatric program, home care, and operates a research institute, philanthropic foundation, and Hennepin EMS. The system is operated by Hennepin Healthcare System, Inc., a subsidiary corporation of Hennepin County. Equal Employment Opportunities: We believe equity is essential for optimal health outcomes and are committed to achieve optimal health for all by actively eliminating barriers due to racism, poverty, gender identity, and other determinants of health. We are committed to equitable care and working in an environment that celebrates, promotes, and protects diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. We are committed to bringing in individuals with new cultural perspectives to assist in creating a more equitable healthcare organization.  SUMMARY We are currently seeking a Healthcare Research Data Scientist to join our team. This full time role will work days (primarily remote). Purpose of this position: The Data Scientist provides high level data analytics and statistical support to the organization and its researchers. Using multiple reporting and data visualization tools, the Data Scientist provides insights and is able present data to operational stakeholders and researchers in a meaningful way while also partnering and advising on the nuances of the data. A successful Data Scientist should be adept at managing multiple projects and driving forward progress with limited supervision. The ideal candidate should be motivated, driven, and creative while also willing to pitch in and help take on some functions of a Business Intelligence Developer as needed.  Remote Employment: There are the 15 states (outside of Minnesota) where Hennepin Healthcare can hire remote employees: Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Iowa, Nevada, North Carolina, North Dakota, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Wisconsin RESPONSIBILITIES Applies statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various data in support of published articles Utilizes knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts such as regression, statistical tests and experience applying those techniques Consults with Subject matter experts to understand the underlying workflows and processes Generates hypotheses about the underlying workflows and data collection techniques Partners with researchers and operational leaders to understand their hypothesis and give recommendations on processes Extracts data from EHR to supply researchers with data to meet their research needs Performs data mining. Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets Interprets data and develops recommendations based on findings Responsible for the ongoing monitoring and refinement of reports and troubleshooting complex issues Provides consultation and expertise in Geocoding and mapping Understands, interprets, and optimizes predictive models Utilizes data presentation skills to deliver results to senior leadership across the organization Trains and coaches peers on basic data science principles  QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, data science, operations research, statistics or related field Five years of experience in data analysis within a healthcare institution Two to four years of experience extracting data using SQL, SAS, R or similar tools -OR- An approved equivalent combination of education and experience Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree Experience in research, healthcare outcomes research, health statistics, health services research, or quality improvement Experience with predictive models and/or Epic predictive models License/Certifications: Epic Clarity Certification in a Clarity Clinical data model or the ability to obtain certification within 9 months Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Firm understanding of the nuances of the healthcare business structure and the ability to apply this knowledge to analytical projects Strong data manipulation techniques and proficiencies Knowledge of report writing, strong SQL, WEBi, and/or Crystal Reports skills Ability to query large relational databases Knowledge of statistics and statistical processes Knowledge of ArcGIS mapping software or similar programs Expert problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to create meaningful data visualizations Very Strong verbal and written communication skills Knowledge of coding and classification systems Understanding of risk adjustment models, outcome measurements and Database design Cardiovascular Services of America (CVAUSA), the largest private and independent cardiology network in the United States. Our inclusive and diverse network brings together top cardiovascular specialists and thought leaders who offer regional perspectives and a broad strategic vision for the future of patient care. The Data Analyst will be a key part of our Data and Analytics team. This person will focus on deriving information from a wide range of sources including medical records, billing data, claims data, geographic information, and publicly available datasets. S/he will be involved in all aspects of the analytic process from requirements gathering to delivery of findings. A successful candidate will combine skills in several areas including gathering information from business users, developing detailed specifications for measures and analytic techniques, programming, testing and QA, providing insight into findings, report design, and delivery. Our team will work with the Data Analyst to develop his or her skills in these areas in order to help Data Analyst develop a well-rounded skill set. We are looking for candidates who want to become accomplished data analysts with a wide range of skills that will eventually help them grow into leaders in the field. The ideal candidate will be eager to learn and contribute to our team, will enjoy challenges, and commit to producing high quality work. Job responsibilities: Job responsibilities: Gather information from business users about their analytic needs. This aspect of the job will require filling in information necessary to meet the business requirements. Write specifications for measures, reports, and other deliverables for our end-users. Learn and use healthcare coding systems that are commonly used by providers and insurers in our industry. Learn and understand healthcare privacy laws and norms and apply those to the work. Examine raw data (from the data warehouse) to see if the specifications developed earlier in the analytic process will work with our data assets. Use industry standard software for accessing our company's data warehouse, such as SQL and Python. Write Python (or similar language) code that converts raw data into the measures and reports our users need. Use libraries like Pandas, Polars, and statsmodels for analysis of the data and libraries like Matplotlib and Plotly for visualization. Write clear documentation of your work so that others can review your logic and code and, if necessary, help with projects. Use Power BI to create reports, dashboards, and visualizations for end-users. Use Excel for report sharing and for further analysis of the data. Perform quality checks on the data and the analysis to ensure accuracy of our information. Develop written reports and presentations for a wide range of end users from finance professionals to clinicians. Gather information from business users about their analytic needs. This aspect of the job will require filling in information necessary to meet the business requirements. Write specifications for measures, reports, and other deliverables for our end-users. Learn and use healthcare coding systems that are commonly used by providers and insurers in our industry. Learn and understand healthcare privacy laws and norms and apply those to the work. Use Power BI to create reports, dashboards, and visualizations for end-users. Use Excel for report sharing and for further analysis of the data. Perform quality checks on the data and the analysis to ensure accuracy of our information. Develop written reports and presentations for a wide range of end users from finance professionals to clinicians. Skills: Skills: Strong analytic thinking. The Data Analyst must be able to identify gaps in specifications and ask non-technical users questions that fill those gaps. S/he must also be able to think through the limitations and implications of findings. Strong programming skills. While not a programmer, the Data Analyst must be able to write code to access, process, and aggregate data into meaningful findings. The ideal candidate would have strong skills with Python (and its data analysis libraries) and SQL. Microsoft Excel. Inevitably, Excel is a key part of most data analysts' toolboxes. Data analysis techniques. The Data Analyst should have a strong understanding of basic statistics and be able to apply that understanding to his or her work. Attention to detail. The Data Analyst must ensure accuracy in his or her work (and that of fellow team members), recognize anomalies in the results, and perform investigations into potential problems. Good communication skills. Clearly conveying findings, both written and orally, to non-technical stakeholders. This includes creating reports and presentations that gives the insights from the data. Teamwork. The Data Analyst must be able to work as part of a team, helping others, asking for help as needed, and collaborating on large programs. Problem solving. Our work often presents challenges, such as gaps in our data, to which we must find solutions. The Data Analyst should be able to think about alternative approaches. Commitment to excellence and continuous improvement. The Data Analyst must be able to learn from the challenges they face in their daily work, try to find better ways to solve them, and be committed to getting better at the job on a daily basis. We will consider candidates with a wide range of backgrounds from quantitative psychology to engineering. Technical aptitude to either use or learn programming languages like Python or R, SQL, and Excel macros (Visual Basic). While specific languages may be learned on the job, the candidate should demonstrate programming skills in the language of his or her choice and existing skills in the languages above are preferred. 1-5 years of work experience in the field, possibly including internships. This is a "growth position" in which we expect the candidate to demonstrate continued growth and development. Healthcare knowledge and experience is a plus, but is not required. column2: Data Analyst REMOTE FROM ANYWHERE IN THE USA
column5: aytm “Ask Your Target Market” is hiring a Data Analyst specializing in data processing and research analytics to join our growing research services team. This position will assist in determining appropriate data processing needs for clients and execute data analysis associated with quantitative market research projects. The data analyst works with internal research team members, Account Management and Business Development teams to design and provide customized back-end deliverables either independently, or with vendor support.  About Us: aytm delivers state-of-the-art insights automation technology and expert guidance that’s focused on providing answers for the clients of today, while evolving a platform that supports the curious of tomorrow. Advancing research with transparency and flexibility, aytm helps you connect to a community of people, optimize your products, positioning, and concepts, and get from idea to market faster. We have a world-class platform, top-tier clients, and a creative and energetic team.  We offer a Zero Commute, 100% remote work environment, flexible hours, a friendly and energizing Slack-connected team, competitive salary and top-notch benefits.  Responsibilities: Work within the research services team to conduct full and partial service quantitative market research projects across numerous research methodologies and a diverse set of clients. Execute data-centric deliverables including data manipulation (e.g., stacking, appends, weighting), custom data tables/crosstabs, interactive template-based deliverables (e.g., conjoint simulators), and data visualization and reporting. Work closely with internal team members to ensure the smooth execution and on-time delivery of research services including programmed survey links, custom data tables, simulators, reports, and other deliverables. Work directly with clients in an “Assisted-DIY” fashion, supporting AYTM end users by providing expert advising on advanced methodologies that are automated on the platform (e.g., choice-based conjoint, TURF, etc.), answering data and analysis questions, and executing one-off analysis requests as needed. Serve as a knowledge resource to other internal teams, including Business Development/Account Management, Client Training, and Product Development. Coordinate with external vendors for any back-end requirements Work/communicate both as an individual and as part of a team in a matrixed environment  Qualifications: Undergraduate degree in marketing, social sciences, mathematics or other related field, with a quantitative emphasis on statistics or research methods, or equivalent work experience. 3+ years client-facing experience in data processing as relates to quantitative market research on the supplier side. Strong experience with data-intensive aspects of online survey research: programming, data analysis, data processing and advanced methodologies. Skilled user of the Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint. Advanced proficiency in at least one data processing or statistical analysis software (example: Q, Quantum, SPSS, MarketSight, Decipher, IBM SurveyProfessional, R). Advanced understanding of data structure, manipulation & storage, including best practices. Ability to translate conceptual objectives into actionable data and analytics related tasks). Experience using one or more online survey platforms. Experience with the aytm platform is preferred, but not required. Strong written and verbal skills and should enjoy taking a consultative and collaborative approach – both with clients and fellow team members.  What we offer: A work environment built around empathy, creativity, curiosity, organic growth and an abundance mindset. We’re a fun and vibrant group of people, dedicated to putting in the hard work to make a platform we are proud of, serving the needs of our clients with empathy, and making aytm an incredible place to work. We were recently awarded 2021 Inc 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Company and 2021 Inc Best Places to Work. We’re also fully virtually, which means you’ll be working remotely from the location of your choosing (home, coffee house, library). While being a Zero-commute company and providing you with an amazing level of freedom, convenience, and flexibility, it requires a certain inner discipline and capacity to be effective at a distance. Remote work experience is preferred, but not required..  Benefits would include: Unlimited PTO - With a recommended minimum number of days taken each year Affordable Insurance -$0 deductible Health plans plus dental, vision, and more! 401k retirement - Account with automatic company contributions Dependent Care - a pre-tax benefit account that you can fund to pay for eligible dependent care services Professional Development - Bring your professional Development needs to the table and get your career nourished In-Home Snack allowance - Who doesn’t love some yummies to get you through the day? Cellphone/Internet credits - Get tax-free credits to use toward your cell phone and internet utilities. Equipment and Structured Onboarding - We will provide you will the equipment and tools you need along with great onboarding courses to make sure you are set up for success. Paid Volunteer Time - We support you helping others Great colleagues and an opportunity to sail into uncharted waters with a profitable company that is changing its industry!  **aytm is an Equal Opportunity Employer and committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture and workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, military status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, genetic information, medical condition, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation. aytm “Ask Your Target Market” is hiring a Data Analyst specializing in data processing and research analytics to join our growing research services team.
